definitions: annual horse race for three-year-old thoroughbreds
hard felt hat with rounded crown and narrow brim
local sports competition between nearby rival teams or clubs
examples: The Kentucky Derby attracts thousands of spectators every May
She placed a substantial bet on her favorite horse in the derby
He tipped his black derby hat politely to the passing ladies
The vintage derby complemented his formal Victorian-era costume perfectly
The local derby between the two football clubs always draws huge crowds
Their roller derby team won the regional championship last season

definitions: process of removing government rules and restrictions from an industry or sector
examples: Financial deregulation in the 1980s transformed the banking industry significantly
The airline industry experienced major changes after deregulation allowed competitive pricing

definitions: person without home or means of support living on streets
abandoned building or vessel left in poor condition without maintenance
examples: The social worker helped the derelict find shelter for the winter
Several derelicts gathered around the fire barrel to keep warm
The old derelict near the harbor posed a safety hazard to children
They converted the derelict warehouse into luxury apartments last year

definitions: state of being abandoned and left in poor condition
willful neglect of responsibility or obligation especially by public official
examples: The building's dereliction made it unsafe for any occupants
Years of dereliction left the estate in complete ruins
The officer faced charges for dereliction of duty during the crisis
His dereliction of parental responsibilities harmed the children's welfare significantly

definitions: contemptuous ridicule or mockery expressed through laughter or scornful comments
examples: His unconventional ideas were met with derision from the scientific community
The crowd's derision made the performer leave the stage early

definitions: process of obtaining or developing something from a source or origin
formation of words from roots or existing words through affixes
mathematical process of finding derivatives or tracing logical steps
examples: The derivation of this custom dates back to ancient religious practices
Scientists studied the derivation of the new compound from natural substances
The derivation of 'happiness' from 'happy' involves adding the suffix -ness
Understanding word derivation helps students expand their vocabulary more effectively
The mathematical derivation required several complex steps to complete
She showed the complete derivation of the formula on the whiteboard

definitions: something derived or obtained from another source or original
financial contract whose value depends on underlying asset price or rate
rate of change of function with respect to variable in calculus
examples: This medicine is a derivative of an ancient herbal remedy
Many modern plastics are derivatives of petroleum products
The bank lost millions trading complex derivatives during the crisis
Options and futures are common types of financial derivatives
Calculate the derivative of this polynomial function for homework
The derivative represents the instantaneous rate of change

definitions: act of obtaining or receiving something from a specified source or origin
examples: Deriving pleasure from simple activities enriches daily life considerably
The company focuses on deriving maximum value from renewable resources

definitions: medical doctor specializing in diagnosis and treatment of skin, hair, and nail conditions
examples: The dermatologist examined the suspicious mole during the appointment
She visits her dermatologist annually for a complete skin cancer screening

definitions: branch of medicine dealing with skin, hair, nails and their diseases
examples: She decided to specialize in dermatology after medical school graduation
The hospital's dermatology department treats thousands of patients annually

definitions: crane with movable pivoted arm for moving heavy weights
framework tower over oil well supporting drilling equipment
examples: The construction derrick lifted steel beams to the twentieth floor
Workers operated the derrick carefully to position the massive generator
The oil derrick stood prominently against the Texas desert skyline
Multiple derricks dotted the offshore platform in the gulf

definitions: small pocket pistol with short barrel designed for concealment and close range
examples: The gambler kept a derringer hidden in his vest pocket
The antique derringer was displayed in the museum's weapons collection

definitions: member of Muslim religious order known for devotional exercises including whirling dances
examples: The whirling dervish spun in meditation for nearly an hour
Tourists gathered to watch the dervishes perform their sacred ceremony

definitions: process of removing salt and minerals from seawater to produce fresh drinking water
examples: The coastal city relies on desalination plants for its water supply
Advanced desalination technology makes desert coastal development possible

definitions: person, animal, or plant descended from particular ancestor or predecessors
thing that has developed or been derived from something earlier
examples: She discovered she was a direct descendant of a famous explorer
The descendants of the original settlers still live in the valley
This programming language is a descendant of earlier computing systems
Modern birds are descendants of certain dinosaur species

definitions: person descended from particular ancestor or family line
examples: The descendent of the royal family claimed the disputed throne
Many descendents of immigrants maintain their cultural traditions proudly

definitions: act of moving downward through space or along a surface
family origin or background traced through generations of ancestors
gradual deterioration or decline into worse condition or state
examples: The plane began its descent toward the airport runway
The hikers planned their descent from the mountain summit carefully
She traced her descent through five generations of Italian immigrants
People of African descent faced discrimination throughout American history
His descent into addiction destroyed his promising medical career
The country's descent into chaos followed the government's collapse

definitions: spoken or written account giving details about something or someone
sort, kind, or class of things sharing common characteristics
examples: The witness gave a detailed description of the suspect's appearance
Her description of the sunset was remarkably vivid and poetic
Vehicles of every description filled the massive parking lot
They sell books of all descriptions at the annual fair

definitions: word or expression used to describe or identify something
data element or tag that identifies file or data characteristics
examples: The job posting included several key descriptors for ideal candidates
Sensory descriptors help wine tasters communicate flavor profiles effectively
The database uses descriptors to categorize and retrieve information
File descriptors allow the operating system to manage open files

definitions: action of treating sacred place or thing with violent disrespect or damage
examples: The desecration of the cemetery outraged the entire community
Vandals were arrested for desecration of the historic church

definitions: process of ending enforced separation of racial or ethnic groups in schools and public facilities
examples: School desegregation in the 1960s transformed American education fundamentally
The desegregation of public transportation followed years of protests

definitions: process of making less sensitive to stimulus through repeated exposure or treatment
examples: Gradual desensitization helped her overcome her fear of flying
Media violence may cause desensitization to real-world aggression

definitions: dry barren area with little rainfall and sparse vegetation
act of abandoning duty, post, or relationship without permission
reward or punishment that is deserved or merited
examples: The Sahara desert covers much of northern Africa
Desert plants have adapted to survive with minimal water
His desert of his military post resulted in court martial
The desert of the mining town left buildings empty
The criminal finally received his just deserts after years
Success was the desert of her years of hard work

definitions: person who abandons military service without permission or lawful discharge
examples: The deserter was captured trying to cross the border
Military deserters faced severe punishment during wartime

definitions: process by which fertile land becomes desert through drought, deforestation, or inappropriate agriculture
examples: Desertification threatens agricultural communities across sub-Saharan Africa
Overgrazing accelerated desertification in the grassland regions

definitions: act of leaving military service, duty, or family without permission or justification
examples: His desertion of his family left them in financial hardship
The soldier's desertion during battle was considered treason

definitions: process of extreme drying or removal of moisture from something
examples: The desiccation of the lake bed revealed ancient fossils
Food preservation through desiccation dates back thousands of years

definitions: plan or drawing showing how something will be made or arranged
decorative pattern or artistic arrangement of elements
purpose or planning behind an action or creation
examples: The architect presented her design for the new museum
The design incorporated both form and function beautifully
The fabric features an intricate floral design
Traditional design motifs decorated the ceramic vases
There was clear design in how she arranged the meeting
By design or accident, they arrived at the same conclusion

definitions: official appointment to a particular position or status
name, title, or identifying mark given to something
examples: Her designation as CEO was announced at the board meeting
The designation of protected status saved the wetlands from development
The designation 'organic' requires meeting strict agricultural standards
Military designation codes identify different types of aircraft

definitions: person who plans and creates the form and structure of objects, graphics, or spaces
expensive high-fashion brand or product created by famous designer
examples: The fashion designer showcased her collection at Paris Fashion Week
They hired an interior designer to renovate their home
She only wears designer clothes from exclusive boutiques
Designer handbags can cost thousands of dollars

definitions: process of planning and creating the structure and form of something
examples: Designing the new website took three months of careful work
She specialized in designing sustainable residential buildings

definitions: quality of being wanted, attractive, or worth having
examples: The desirability of waterfront property keeps prices extremely high
Marketing campaigns focus on increasing product desirability among consumers

definitions: strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen
strong sexual attraction or appetite for someone
examples: Her desire for success motivated years of hard work
The desire for freedom sparked the revolution
Their mutual desire was evident to everyone around them
He struggled to control his desire for his colleague

definitions: table with drawers used for writing, reading, or working
counter or station where specific service is provided
examples: She organized her desk before starting the project
The antique desk had belonged to his grandfather
Please check in at the reception desk upon arrival
The information desk is located near the main entrance

definitions: working area of computer screen showing icons and windows
personal computer designed to remain in fixed location
examples: Save the file directly to your desktop for easy access
Her desktop was cluttered with dozens of file icons
The desktop computer was more powerful than her laptop
They upgraded all office desktops to newer models

definitions: state of complete emptiness, destruction, or abandonment of a place
feeling of extreme sadness, loneliness, and hopelessness
examples: The desolation of the abandoned town was truly haunting
Years of war left nothing but desolation across the landscape
After her husband's death, she felt complete desolation
The desolation in his eyes revealed his inner suffering

definitions: complete loss or absence of hope about the future
examples: She fell into despair after losing her job and home
The team played on despite their despair at being behind

definitions: sending of message, goods, or person to destination
act of killing someone or something quickly
examples: The despatch of urgent medical supplies saved many lives
Regular despatch of reports kept headquarters fully informed
The despatch of the wounded animal was done humanely
Quick despatch of enemies was essential to survival

definitions: bold or violent criminal, especially in the American Old West
examples: The desperado robbed three banks before being captured
Western films often featured desperados terrorizing frontier towns

definitions: person who has lost all hope or is willing to do anything
examples: The desperate turned to crime to feed their families
Only a desperate would attempt such a dangerous escape

definitions: state of despair resulting in rash or extreme behavior
examples: In desperation, she sold everything she owned to pay debts
His desperation led him to make increasingly poor decisions

definitions: feeling of contempt or scorn for someone or something
examples: He regarded his enemies with complete despite
Her despite for authority made her a rebel

definitions: ruler who exercises absolute power in cruel or oppressive way
examples: The despot ruled the country with an iron fist
History remembers him as a brutal despot who tolerated no dissent

definitions: exercise of absolute power in cruel and oppressive way
examples: The revolution ended decades of despotism and oppression
Despotism thrives when citizens become complacent about their rights

definitions: sweet course eaten at the end of a meal
examples: The chocolate mousse was the perfect dessert after dinner
She always saved room for dessert at her favorite restaurant

definitions: process of making government, economy, or situation unstable or less secure
examples: Foreign interference caused the destabilization of the democratic government
Economic destabilization led to widespread social unrest

definitions: place to which someone or something is going or being sent
examples: Paris was their dream destination for their honeymoon
The package reached its destination after three days

definitions: events that will necessarily happen to someone or something in the future
examples: She believed it was her destiny to become a doctor
The nation's destiny was shaped by that crucial decision

definitions: state of extreme poverty lacking basic necessities of life
examples: The war left thousands of families in complete destitution
Government programs aimed to prevent destitution among the elderly

definitions: fast warship designed to protect larger vessels and attack submarines
person or thing that ruins, damages, or eliminates something
examples: The destroyer escorted the aircraft carrier through hostile waters
Three destroyers patrolled the shipping lanes for submarines
He was known as a destroyer of reputations in politics
Time is the ultimate destroyer of all human achievements
